Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The property is situated on Victoria Road in Washington, approximately 11 miles south of Newcastle and 8 miles west of Sunderland.
The subject property occupies a position on Arndale House. The parade is well let and is the principle retail pitch in the town area. National occupiers in Arndale House include Boots, Savers, Greggs and Paddy Power.
To the rear is a car park providing circa 80 spaces.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over ground floor only, comprising a large sales area, customer toilets, storage facilities and staff accommodation including kitchenette and toilets. There is an external yard which allows for access through the rear.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 13/10/2024.
Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £31,000.00 and the rates payable are £15,469.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.90p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is located on the pedestrianised Nelson Street in Newcastle city centre. The unit is directly adjacent to Grainger Market entrance, thus benefitting from a return frontage. The market houses numerous local traders and businesses. Opposite the store is an entrance to the Eldon Square Shopping Centre which boasts annual footfall of 37 million. In Addition, there are numerous high quality leisure occupiers in the immediate vicinity, with The Alchemist and Reds BBQ being directly opposite. National retailers in the vicinity include End Men’s Wear, Coral and Ladbrokes.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is a ground floor only unit comprising a large sales area and customer toilets.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 15/05/2033. There is a tenant break option on 15/05/2023. Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease until 15/05/2023.

Rent
The current passing rent is £60,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £47,750.00 and the rates payable are £23,445.25 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is located on New Bridge Street in central Newcastle upon Tyne, within 100 metres of prime Northumberland Street. The property is immediately opposite the new leisure attraction, 'The Stack', which has helped strengthen the pitch and increase dwell time in the vicinity. Major bus routes supply both Pilgrim Street and New Bridge Street with bus stops directly outside the subject property. Occupiers on New Bridge Street include Nationwide and Five Guys while other occupiers in the vicinity include North Face and TK Maxx.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The demise has a large, glazed frontage and is arranged over ground floor and basement of Pearl Assurance House, close to the corner of Northumberland Street and New Bridge Street. The ground floor comprises a large main sales area, interview rooms with ancillary staff areas. The basement comprises male and female WCs, a staff room with kitchen facilities, plant room and further storage.

Tenure
The property is held on an existing lease expiring 03/02/2024.

Rent
The current passing rent is £115,000 per annum exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £123,000.00 and the rates payable are £61,992.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 50.40p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The Property is situated in a commanding position on pedestrianised Northumberland Street adjacent to Primark and McDonalds and opposite M&S and the Entrance to Eldon Square Shopping Centre. Other Retailers in close proximity include JD Sports , Superdrug and H&M.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Imposing Flagship Store, the Property benefits from full height glazed frontage across its triple fronted elevation to Northumberland Street affording it huge prominence and visibility and provides a substantial and well configured modern unit totalling 32,573 sq ft arranged over ground, basement , and three upper floors. The Property is currently configured to provide high quality sales accommodation at ground , basement and first floor with additional ancillary accommodation arranged over the 2nd and 3rd Floors.

Legal Costs
Each side will bear their own legal and professional costs incurred

Rent
Quoting rental available on request.Quoting rental available on request.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £1,040,000.00 and the rates payable are £524,160.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 50.40p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: SUPERB 100% PRIME CITY CENTRE FLAGSHIP STORE

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Newcastle benefits from excellent road communications with Junction 65 of the A1(M) situated approximately 9 miles to the south of the city. Rail links are good with direct services to London to the south and Edinburgh to the north. The city also benefits from its own airport and metro systems.

The property occupies a position on Ridley Place, a short distance from Northumberland Street. Ridley Place benefits from having on street parking directly outside the unit. The street comprises a mix of local and national occupiers including Subway.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises occupy the ground and basement floor of a four-storey building. The ground floor comprises a main sales area, staff accommodation, customer toilets and storage space. The basement provides additional large storage.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 28/07/2022.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £22,500, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £21,000 and the rates payable are £10,311 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.1p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Whitley Bay is a seaside town on the north east coast approximately 9 miles north east of Newcastle Upon Tyne.

The subject unit occupies a position on a busy retail circuit in Whitley Lodge, a suburb of Whitley Bay, approximately 1 mile north of the town centre. Adjacent is Tesco Express while other occupiers in the scheme include Boots and local traders.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is a single storey unit comprising a large sales area, customer toilets, staff accommodation and storage facilities. There is a fire exit at the rear leading to a shared loading area/staff parking.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 09/09/2028.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £13,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £17,750 and the rates payable are £8,715.25 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.1p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes
